sections.title: Correspondence Clerk User Guide
sections.content: Welcome to Correspondence Clerk! This guide will help you get started and make the most of your digital letter file system.

sections.content:
Getting Started (#getting-started)

sections.title: What is Correspondence Clerk?
sections.content:
Correspondence Clerk is your digital filing system for business correspondence. Think of it as replacing those Word documents where you used to copy and paste emails and call notes. Instead of manually maintaining letter files for each business, Correspondence Clerk does it automatically.

What it does:
• Files emails, calls, and meeting notes in one place
• Organizes everything by business, in chronological order
• Makes past correspondence instantly searchable
• Generates print-ready documents when you need them
• Helps teams share visibility into business relationships

What it doesn't do:
• It's not a CRM - no sales pipeline or deal tracking
• It doesn't suggest next steps or auto-follow-ups
• It doesn't rewrite your words - it preserves your voice exactly

sections.title: Quick Overview (5-Minute Tour)
sections.content:
Dashboard - See all your businesses at a glance, sorted by what needs attention
New Entry - Paste an email or type call notes, select the business and person
Business Letter File - View the complete correspondence history for any business
Search - Find past conversations by keyword or business name
Export - Generate a Google Doc with all correspondence for a business

sections.title: How to Log In
sections.content:
Open your browser and go to your Correspondence Clerk URL (provided by your administrator)
Enter your email address and password
If you're a new team member, use the invitation link sent to your email

First time logging in?
• You'll be asked to create an organization (if you're the first user)
• Or you'll join an existing organization (if you were invited)

sections.title: First-Time Setup
sections.content:
If you're starting fresh:
Log in and create your organization
Import your business list (optional - you can also add them as you go)
Start filing correspondence

If you're joining a team:
Accept your invitation via email
You'll immediately see all businesses and correspondence your team has filed
Start adding new entries right away

sections.title: Dashboard Overview
sections.content:
The Dashboard is your home base. It answers one question: What needs doing?

How it's sorted:
Action needed - businesses with follow-ups, invoices, or renewals
Overdue - entries with past-due dates
Least recently contacted - businesses you haven't touched in a while

Each business card shows:
• Business name
• Category (e.g., Club Card, Advertiser)
• Status flags
• Last contacted date
• Action needed badge (if any)
• Overdue badge (if any)

Filtering options:
• All businesses
• Club Card only
• Advertiser only
• Action needed only

Quick actions:
• Click any card to view the full letter file
• Search bar at the top to find a business by name

sections.title: Creating a New Entry
sections.content:
This is how you file correspondence - whether it's an email, phone call, or meeting notes.

Step 1: Paste or type your content

In the large text area, you can:
• Paste an entire email (including headers and thread history)
• Type notes from a phone call
• Copy meeting notes

Step 2: Select the business

Start typing the business name and select from the dropdown. If the business doesn't exist:
• Click "Add New Business"
• Enter the name and optional details
• Save and continue

Step 3: Select the contact

Choose the person you corresponded with. The dropdown shows:
• Contact name
• Role (if recorded)
• Email address (if recorded)

If the person doesn't exist:
• Click "Add New Contact"
• Enter their name (required)
• Add their role, email, phone (optional but recommended)

Why you must name a contact:
This ensures your letter file is always clear about who you spoke with. No "Unknown" placeholders allowed.

Step 4: Set optional fields
• Entry type - Email, Call, or Meeting (auto-detected from pasted content)
• Action needed - Mark if follow-up is required (none, prospect, follow-up, etc.)
• Due date - Set a reminder date for follow-ups

Step 5: Save

Click "Save Entry" and you're done. The entry is filed, the business letter file is updated, and the dashboard reflects the new activity.

What happens when you save:
Your original text is preserved exactly as entered
AI improves the layout and spacing (if available)
The entry appears in the business letter file
Business "last contacted" date is updated
You're taken to the business page to see the saved entry

If AI formatting fails:
Don't worry - your entry saves anyway as "unformatted". You can format it later when the AI service is back online.

sections.title: Understanding Email Thread Splitting
sections.content:
When you paste an email chain (multiple back-and-forth emails), Correspondence Clerk can detect it and offer to split it into individual entries.

How it works:
Paste an email thread
If detected, you'll see a toggle: "Split into individual emails"
Toggle ON to split, OFF to keep as one entry
Preview shows how many entries will be created
Confirm and save

When to split:
• Long email threads with multiple back-and-forth messages
• When you want each email dated separately in the letter file

When not to split:
• Single email with quoted history at the bottom
• Call notes or meeting notes (not applicable)
• Short exchanges where one entry is clearer

What gets split:
• Each distinct email in the thread
• In chronological order (oldest first)
• Each gets its own date, sender, subject

What doesn't get split:
• AI doesn't invent missing emails
• Incomplete threads stay intact
• If uncertain, splitting is turned OFF by default

sections.title: Searching for Past Correspondence
sections.content:
Find anything you've filed, fast.

Search by business name:
• Type in the search bar
• Results prioritize business name matches
• Click any result to view that business's letter file

Search by keyword:
• Type any word or phrase from past correspondence
• Results show matching entries across all businesses
• Highlights show where your search term appears

Search tips:
• Use specific terms (e.g., "contract renewal" not "contract")
• Business names always rank higher than keyword matches
• Search is case-insensitive
• Searches across both original and formatted text

Results show:
• Business name
• Entry date and type
• Contact name
• Snippet with your search term highlighted
• Quick link to view the full entry

sections.title: Exporting to Google Docs
sections.content:
Create a print-ready Google Doc with all correspondence for a business.

How to export:
Open any business letter file
Click "Export to Google Docs"
Wait a few seconds (longer for businesses with many entries)
A link to your new Google Doc appears

What's included:
• Cover page with business name, category, status
• Contact list with roles and details
• All correspondence entries in chronological order
• Page break between each entry
• Entry format: Subject, date/type/contact, formatted text

What's not included:
• Original unformatted text (only the clean formatted version)
• Deleted entries
• Draft entries (if applicable in future versions)

Where does it go:
The Google Doc is created in your Google Drive, in the same folder as the document (or root if no folder specified).

Tip:
You can share, print, or further edit the Google Doc as needed. It's yours.

sections.title: Managing Contacts and Businesses
sections.content:
Viewing contacts for a business:
Open any business letter file
Scroll to the "Contacts" section
See all recorded contacts with roles, emails, phones

Adding a new contact:
• From the New Entry page: Click "Add New Contact" when selecting
• From the Business page: Click "Add Contact" in the Contacts section

Editing contact details:
• Click the edit icon next to any contact
• Update name, role, email, phone
• Changes apply immediately

Why contact details matter:
When you file correspondence, seeing role and contact details helps you:
• Confirm you're selecting the right person
• Update info as you learn it (promotions, new emails, etc.)
• Keep your letter file clear about who is who

Adding a new business:
• From the New Entry page: Click "Add New Business" when selecting
• From the Dashboard: Use the "New Business" button (if available)
• From import: Bulk import businesses from CSV (admin feature)

Editing business details:
• Open the business letter file
• Click "Edit Business" (if available)
• Update name, category, status, flags

sections.title: Team Collaboration
sections.content:
Who sees what:
In Correspondence Clerk, everyone in your organization sees all businesses and correspondence. This ensures team visibility and prevents duplicated effort.

When you file an entry:
• It's attributed to you (your name appears on the entry)
• But everyone can see it, search it, and export it
• This is by design - shared knowledge is the goal

Inviting team members:
Go to Settings > Organization
Enter their email address
They receive an invitation link
Once accepted, they're part of your team

Revoking access:
(Future feature - currently all team members have equal access)

sections.title: What Gets Saved When You Create an Entry
sections.content:
Every correspondence entry stores multiple versions:
raw_text_original - Your exact input, never modified
formatted_text_original - AI-formatted version when first saved
formatted_text_current - The version displayed (can be manually edited)

Why three versions?
• Safety net: Your original text is always preserved
• Clarity: Formatted text is easier to read and print
• Flexibility: You can manually correct errors without losing history

Other saved data:
• Entry date (auto-detected or manually set)
• Subject line (guessed from content)
• Entry type (Email, Call, Meeting)
• Business and contact links
• Who created it and when
• Action needed flag and due date
• AI processing metadata (for troubleshooting)

sections.title: How the App Preserves Your Original Text
sections.content:
Hard rule: Your words are never rewritten.

When AI formats your text, it only:
• Improves spacing and line breaks
• Formats bullet points and numbered lists
• Makes headers more readable
• Cleans up email artifacts (like quoted text markers)

What it doesn't do:
• Change your wording or tone
• Summarize or shorten
• Add suggestions or next steps
• Invent content

You can always access the original:
Every entry keeps raw_text_original intact forever. If you ever need to see what you originally pasted, it's there.

sections.title: Where Backups Are Stored
sections.content:
Your data is stored in a Supabase PostgreSQL database. Supabase handles:
• Daily automated backups
• Point-in-time recovery (ask your administrator)
• Encrypted storage
• Geographic redundancy

What this means for you:
• Your data is safe from accidental deletion
• Catastrophic failures are recoverable
• You don't need to manually back up

Exporting for local backup:
You can export any business to Google Docs, which creates a separate copy in your Google Drive.

sections.title: Data Structure Explained Simply
sections.content:
Think of your data like a filing cabinet:

Filing Cabinet = Your Organization
• Shared by your whole team

Drawer = Businesses
• Each business has its own drawer
• Contains all correspondence with that business

Folders = Contacts
• People at each business
• Every piece of correspondence is filed under a person

Pages = Correspondence Entries
• Individual emails, call notes, meeting notes
• In chronological order
• Each "page" includes the date, type, and person involved

Connections:
• Contacts belong to a business (you can't have a "floating" contact)
• Correspondence always links to both a business and a specific contact
• If you delete a business, all its contacts and correspondence are deleted (with confirmation)

sections.title: How Your Data is Stored
sections.content:
Businesses

Stores every company or organization you track. Each business has:
• Name and basic details
• Category - the type of business (e.g., Club Card, Advertiser)
• Status flags - Club Card (member) and Advertiser flags
• Last contacted date - automatically updated when you file correspondence
• Contract information - for members and advertisers

Contacts

The people at each business. Each contact has:
• Name (required - you must always name a real person)
• Role or job title - their position at the business
• Email address - primary contact email
• Phone number - contact phone
• Linked to their business - contacts always belong to a specific business

Correspondence

Your filed emails, calls, and meeting notes. Each entry stores:
• Original text (raw_text_original) - never changes, your safety net
• Formatted text (formatted_text_original) - AI-improved layout when first saved
• Current text (formatted_text_current) - the version shown, can be manually edited
• Date, type, contact, business links - all the metadata
• Who saved it and when - tracks which team member created the entry
• Action needed status - none, prospect, follow-up, waiting on them, invoice, renewal
• Due date - optional reminder date for follow-ups

Organizations and Team Members

How teams share data:
• Organizations - your company/team workspace
• User Profiles - each team member's account, linked to an organization
• Invitations - pending invites sent to team members
• Shared visibility - everyone in your organization sees all businesses and correspondence

Data Safety

Your data is protected through:
• Original text preservation - we never modify raw_text_original
• Edit tracking - every edit is timestamped and attributed
• Foreign key constraints - prevents orphaned data
• Automatic backups - Supabase handles daily backups
• Row Level Security - database enforces access permissions

sections.title: Why can't I save without selecting a contact?
sections.content:
This is by design. Correspondence Clerk requires you to name a specific person for every entry because:
• It keeps your letter file clear about who said what
• It prevents vague "someone from XYZ Corp" entries
• It builds a useful contact database over time

If you genuinely don't know the person's name:
• Ask them (in the case of a call)
• Check the email headers (for emails)
• Create a contact like "Sarah [Last Name Unknown]" if necessary

The app won't accept placeholder contacts like "Unknown" or "TBD" - you must name a real person.

sections.title: What happens if AI formatting fails?
sections.content:
You can still save your correspondence. Here's what happens:
You paste or type your content
The app tries to format it with AI
If the AI is unavailable (network issue, API outage, etc.):
• Your entry saves as "unformatted"
• A "Format later" button appears on the entry
When the AI service is back, click "Format later" to retry

Why this matters:
AI outages never block you from filing correspondence. Your work continues uninterrupted.

sections.title: Can I undo a delete?
sections.content:
Currently, deletes are permanent. Before you delete:
• A confirmation dialog appears
• You must explicitly confirm

To prevent accidental deletes:
• Read the confirmation message carefully
• Consider archiving instead of deleting (future feature)

If you accidentally delete:
• Contact your administrator
• They can restore from a backup (recent deletes are recoverable)

sections.title: What if I paste an email thread?
sections.content:
Correspondence Clerk detects email chains and offers to split them into individual entries.

The split toggle:
• Appears when a thread is detected
• Shows a preview of how many entries will be created
• Defaults to ON only when confidence is high
• You must confirm before splitting happens

If the detection is wrong:
• Toggle it OFF to keep as one entry
• Or manually split by pasting each email separately

What if I want to split later?
You can't automatically split an existing entry. Instead:
• Edit the entry to remove parts
• Create new entries for the removed parts

sections.title: Where do my exports go?
sections.content:
Google Doc exports are created in your Google Drive. Specifically:
• In the same folder as the document (if the app has folder context)
• Otherwise, in your Drive root

After export:
• You receive a shareable link
• The document is yours to edit, share, or print
• It's not connected back to Correspondence Clerk (it's a snapshot)

sections.title: How often is data backed up?
sections.content:
Supabase handles daily automated backups of your database. Additionally:
• Point-in-time recovery allows restoring to any moment
• Your administrator can request a restore if needed

You can also:
• Export businesses to Google Docs for your own local backups
• (Future) Full database export for comprehensive backup

sections.title: Can I edit entries after saving?
sections.content:
Yes, but only the formatted text. Here's how it works:

What you can edit:
• formatted_text_current - the displayed version

What you can't edit:
• raw_text_original - permanently preserved
• formatted_text_original - permanently preserved

How to edit:
Open the entry
Click "Edit"
Make your changes
Save

What happens when you edit:
• edited_at timestamp is updated
• edited_by records your user ID
• A small "edited" indicator appears on the entry
• Original versions remain intact

Why it's designed this way:
Edits are for corrections (typos, clarifications), not for rewriting history. You always have the original text as proof of what was actually said.

sections.title: What if Outlook integration isn't working?
sections.content:
Currently, Correspondence Clerk uses manual copy-paste from Outlook (or any email client). There's no direct integration.

To file an Outlook email:
Open the email in Outlook
Select all (Ctrl+A) and copy (Ctrl+C)
Paste into Correspondence Clerk's New Entry page
File as usual

Future enhancement:
Direct Outlook integration may be added to streamline this workflow.

sections.title: What if contact details are missing?
sections.content:
If a contact is missing role, email, or phone:
• When you select them during filing, you'll see the missing fields
• Click "Edit contact details" to add them inline
• You don't have to navigate away - stay in the flow

Why add details:
• Makes it easier to reach them later
• Ensures exports include complete contact information
• Helps teammates know who is who

sections.title: "AI Formatting Failed" - What to Do
sections.content:
What happened:
The AI formatting service (Anthropic API) couldn't process your entry. This could be due to:
• Network connectivity issues
• API service outage
• Rate limiting (too many requests)

What to do:
Your entry is saved as "unformatted" - nothing is lost
A "Format later" button appears on the entry
Wait a few minutes and click "Format later"
If it still fails, contact your administrator

Workaround:
You can manually edit the entry to improve formatting:
Click "Edit" on the unformatted entry
Add line breaks, clean up spacing, format lists
Save your manual edits

Your data is safe:
Even if AI formatting permanently fails, you have the original text saved.

sections.title: "Duplicate Entry Detected" - Your Options
sections.content:
What happened:
Correspondence Clerk noticed you're trying to save an entry that looks very similar to one you recently filed.

Your options:
Save anyway - if this is legitimately a new entry (e.g., follow-up with similar wording)
View existing entry - to confirm it's already filed
Cancel - to avoid the duplicate

Why this check exists:
Prevents accidental double-filing (e.g., pasting the same email twice).

sections.title: Email Thread Split Didn't Work
sections.content:
What went wrong:
The thread detection may have:
• Missed some emails in the chain
• Split incorrectly
• Not detected a thread at all

What to do:
If split incorrectly: Delete the incorrect entries and refile manually
If not detected: Manually split by pasting each email separately
If some emails missed: Add them as separate entries

Why it happens:
Email threads have many formats (Gmail, Outlook, Apple Mail, etc.). The detection is smart but not perfect.

Tip:
For important threads, review the preview before confirming the split.

sections.title: Can't Save Entry (Missing Required Fields)
sections.content:
Required fields:
• Business (must select)
• Contact (must select)
• Content (must have text)

If you can't save:
Check that you've selected a business
Check that you've selected a contact
Ensure there's text in the entry field

If you're missing a contact:
• Click "Add New Contact" to create one
• You must name a real person (no placeholders)

sections.title: Outlook Integration Not Working
sections.content:
Current status:
There's no direct Outlook integration yet. You must manually copy-paste.

Workaround:
Open email in Outlook
Select all (Ctrl+A) and copy (Ctrl+C)
Paste into Correspondence Clerk
File as usual

Future:
Outlook add-in or integration may be developed to streamline this.

sections.title: Contact Details Missing
sections.content:
If a contact is missing role, email, or phone:
Find the contact in the business letter file's Contacts section
Click "Edit" next to the contact
Add the missing details
Save

Or add them during filing:
• When selecting a contact in New Entry
• If details are missing, an "Add details" option appears
• Add inline without leaving the page

sections.title: Inviting Team Members
sections.content:
To invite someone:
Go to Settings > Organization
Click "Invite Team Member"
Enter their email address
They receive an invitation link via email
They click the link, create their account, and join your organization

What they see after joining:
• All businesses you've created
• All correspondence filed by anyone on the team
• They can immediately start filing new entries

Managing invitations:
• View pending invitations in Settings > Organization
• Resend if needed
• Revoke if someone shouldn't join

sections.title: Managing Organization Settings
sections.content:
Organization details:
• Name - your company or team name
• Settings - (future) customization options

Team member list:
• View all active team members
• See who's invited but hasn't accepted yet
• (Future) Remove team members

sections.title: What Everyone Can See (Shared Visibility)
sections.content:
Current permissions (v1):
• Everyone in your organization sees all businesses
• Everyone sees all correspondence
• Everyone can file, edit, search, and export

Why it's designed this way:
Correspondence Clerk is built for team transparency. Shared visibility prevents:
• Duplicated effort (two people following up with the same business)
• Lost context (someone leaves, their correspondence is still accessible)
• Siloed knowledge (everyone benefits from the letter file)

Future versions:
• Per-business access controls
• Read-only users
• Audit trail for edits

sections.title: Action Needed
sections.content: A flag on correspondence entries indicating follow-up is required. Types:

sections.title: Action Needed Types
sections.content:
When filing correspondence, you can flag entries that need follow-up:

none - No action required, just for the record

prospect - New business opportunity, needs initial outreach

follow_up - Requires a response or continued conversation

waiting_on_them - Ball is in their court, waiting for their response

invoice - Need to send or follow up on an invoice

renewal - Contract or membership renewal coming up

These flags help the Dashboard sort businesses by what needs doing.

sections.title: Due Date
sections.content: An optional reminder date for correspondence flagged with "Action Needed". Overdue entries appear at the top of the Dashboard.

sections.title: Thread Splitting
sections.content: The process of detecting an email chain and splitting it into individual entries, each with its own date and sender.

sections.title: Formatting
sections.content:
The process of improving the visual layout of your text using AI. Formatting:
• Adds proper spacing and line breaks
• Formats lists and headers
• Cleans up email artifacts
• Never changes your wording

sections.title: Letter File
sections.content: The chronological feed of correspondence for a business. Like the old Word document letter files, but searchable and automatically maintained.

sections.title: Mastersheet
sections.content: The Chiswick Calendar spreadsheet of businesses, contacts, and contract details. This data can be imported into Correspondence Clerk to seed your business list.

sections.title: MCP (Model Context Protocol)
sections.content: The method used to integrate with Google Docs for exporting letter files.

sections.title: Raw Text Original
sections.content: The exact text you entered when creating a correspondence entry. This field is never modified, serving as your permanent record of what was actually said.

sections.title: Formatted Text Original
sections.content: The AI-formatted version of your text when first saved. Also never modified.

sections.title: Formatted Text Current
sections.content: The version of formatted text currently displayed. This is the only field you can manually edit.

sections.title: Unformatted Entry
sections.content: A correspondence entry that was saved when AI formatting was unavailable. Can be formatted later using the "Format later" button.

sections.title: Organization
sections.content: Your team's workspace in Correspondence Clerk. All team members belong to one organization and share visibility of all data.

sections.title: Contact
sections.content: A person at a business. Every correspondence entry must link to a specific contact (no placeholders allowed).

sections.title: Business
sections.content: A company or organization you track. Businesses contain contacts and correspondence.

sections.title: Why the App Works This Way
sections.content:
You must always name a contact
The app requires you to select (or create) a specific person for every entry. This ensures your letter file is always clear about who you spoke with. No "Unknown" or placeholder contacts allowed.

Your original wording is never changed
When AI formats your text, it only improves layout and spacing. Your actual words are preserved exactly as you wrote them in the raw_text_original field, which is never modified.

Contact details are always visible
When you select a contact, you can immediately see their role, email, and phone. If details are missing, you can add them inline without leaving the filing flow.

AI failure never blocks you
If the AI formatting service is unavailable, you can still save your correspondence. It's marked as "unformatted" and you can format it later when the service is back.

Edits are corrections, not rewrites
When you edit an entry, you're making manual corrections. The AI never rewrites your content. We preserve both the original formatted version and your edited version.

No automatic suggestions
This is a filing system, not a CRM. We don't suggest next steps, auto-follow-ups, or reminders you didn't create. We record what happened.

Clear, labeled actions
Every button and action is clearly labeled. No icon-only buttons that leave you guessing.

Thread splitting is optional
When you paste an email chain, we detect it and offer to split it into individual entries. But you always get to confirm before we do it.

Full text search is fast
We use PostgreSQL's full-text search with GIN indexes, so searching through thousands of entries is near-instant.

Exports are print-ready
Google Docs exports use proper formatting with page breaks, so you can print or share them immediately.

sections.title: Technical Configuration (For Administrators)
sections.content:
These settings are configured during initial setup:

NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL
Where your database is hosted. Set by your administrator during installation. This is the URL of your Supabase project.

NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY
Public key for database access. Safe to expose in browser, as it's protected by Row Level Security policies.

SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY
Admin key for server-side operations. Never expose to the client. Used for operations that bypass RLS.

ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
Enables AI formatting. If this stops working, entries save as "unformatted" until fixed. You can still file correspondence without AI.

NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL
The web address where Correspondence Clerk is accessed (e.g., https://correspondence-clerk.vercel.app).

GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID and GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET
Required for Google Docs export feature. Get these from Google Cloud Console.

What happens if a key stops working?
• If Anthropic API fails: Correspondence saves as "unformatted" - you can format it later
• If Supabase fails: App won't load - contact your administrator
• If Google API fails: Export feature won't work, but filing correspondence continues normally
